science: Testing model representation of seasonal air-sea exchange of O2 and CO2: Comparing historical air-sea O2 and CO2 flux estimates (with heat/tos/sos based N2 correction) to observational constraints. Also comparing O2:CO2 based partitioning of Abiotic:Biotic CO2 flux to model estimates.
comments: These should all be 2d monthly fields, so hopefully not too big. I did not see hist-bgc in the list of experiment IDs. Ultimately, I think hist-bgc would better suit my needs than historical, but I only see 4 models with fgo2 for hist-bgc available so for the hackathon it makes more sense to use historical. I probably only really need 1 instance of each unique ocean model, so if necessary I could cut the list of models down. Also, I did not see a way to specify this, but I probably only need 1 ensemble member for models with multiple realizations or initializations (though if physics or forcing are different those would be useful).Thanks a lot! Britt

I would like to calculate future Arctic light conditions in the water column at high latitudes as a consequences of changing sea-ice conditions. To do this I need sea-ice and snow thickness and concentration, as well as open water conditions from the CMIP6 models. I am currently lacking the sea-ice snow thickness (sisnthick) and would love to have it added to the pangeo collection.
comments: I greatly appreciate how much easier it is to work with CMIP6 compared to CMIP5 due to the online accessible. Thanks for a great job you are doing!

Hi there,I'm working on a new paper looking at changes in heatwaves in the CMIP6 archive. This work requires daily near-surface temperature ('tas') and specific humidity data ('huss') for as many models and experiments as possible. The data already on the Google Cloud have been great at building my hypothesis, but I now want to scale up my analysis to all available models and experiments.Thanks,Michael Byrne
comments: That's it, thanks a lot for setting up this awesome new tool!
I'm sorry for asking for this again, I've seen that new data has come out since previous request. I will probably ask again in the future too! Thank you very much indeed.
